page.title: 18Hatfield Broad Oak Scenery
page.content: {The village as seen by {another eleven year old girl The landscape here is beautiful. All around you are houses which are two or three hundred years old and fine trees lining the gardens. From one of the school windows can be seen a huge fir tree in the grounds of a house called 'Great Chalks' which was built as the vicarage about 150 years ago. Hatfield Broad Oak also has many fine horse chestnut trees. Wherever you stand just outside the village you can look across green and yellow fields to the old priory church. Indeed this village and the surrounding countryside has many lovely views. I hope they will not be destroyed by the expansion of Stansted, only seven miles away, to become London's third airport.
